creator: bmilbratz@participate.com
text:
It appears that the style task has a race condition in 1.5Beta3.

One of my targets uses <style> to process 100+ xml files (generated javadoc 
xml).  

I upgraded to 1.5Beta3 from 1.5Beta2 and all of a sudden the task is failing on 
the <style> task with a NullPointerException. 

It does not fail consistently on the same xml file, i.e. it gets farther with 
subsequent tasks.

I had this problem with an earlier release of 1.5 but it had disappeared with 
1.5Beta2.

creator: bmilbratz@participate.com
text:
>It does not fail consistently on the same xml file, i.e. it gets farther with 
>subsequent tasks.
it gets farther with subsequent builds...because it doesn't fail at on the same 
xml file, this leads me to conclude it's a race condition.

creator: sbailliez@apache.org
text:
Please include 'more details' like a stacktrace or such.
You must be using a Xalan version prior to 2.4D1 (which you can find online) 
There was a bug for the reuse of the transformer.

Please double check. If not reopen the bug and provide more information 
(stacktrace and Xalan version)

creator: bmilbratz@participate.com

creator: bmilbratz@participate.com
donaldp@apache.org
text:
Can confirm this has been occuring for a long time. Partial solution is to 
change Style task (or more specifically XSLTLiason) to recreate a parser for 
each file to be processed. Alternatively you can get a less buggy xslt engine. 

We ended up having to revert to xalan1.x to get any more than one file to be 
processed using a style task.

Definitely not a Ant bug.
Please look over Xalan land and in particular:
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=6719

Add your description and stacktrace so that they look over what's going on.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
sbailliez@apache.org
text: *** Bug 13859 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
